alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 3:20PM AKST until January 01 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW NEW YEARS EVE FOR THE NORTHERN INNER CHANNELS... A warm front will move northward over the northern half of the panhandle Saturday night. Below freezing air persists over the northern Lynn Canal area due to light north wind. These areas will see snow Saturday night, changing to rain near sea level Sunday morning as winds shift to the south. If the winds shift south earlier, then lower snowfall totals are likely near sea level. The Juneau area has already see the warm south wind and will remain primarily rain. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Skagway, Dyea, and the Klondike Highway. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on reduced visibility and slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall rates expected after midnight. Snow levels will rise above 1000 feet near Lynn Canal Sunday morning with a change to rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
